Police: Suspect, 6 others dead at Wisc. Sikh temple

The victims were fatally shot today at a Sikh temple near Milwaukee before the gunman died in a shootout with an officer on scene, officials said. (AP, 6:19 p.m.)

US bid to return salmon
to Connecticut River ends

After almost 50 years and more than $25 million, the federal government is abandoning an effort to restore Atlantic salmon to the Connecticut River.
Opinion | Dan Shaughnessy

Nothing new going on with Red Sox

The Red Sox bosses didn’t miss much while they were overseeing their all-important LeBron James investment at the Olympics in London.

A case study in medical marijuana

A growing industry of farmers and entrepreneurs is seeking to profit from a Maine law that allows patients to buy marijuana, as well as cultivate their own.
Opinion | Joan Vennochi

Mass. gives Obama little help in N.H.

For President Obama to win the state, New Hampshire Democrats will have to fight the battle on their own.

Brown, Warren get down to business

The role of the government and private sector in fueling job creation remains a key point of contention between Senator Scott Brown and Elizabeth Warren.
Opinion | Derrick Z. Jackson

Finding the cure for traffic

Sweden’s capital cut traffic sharply by charging motorists downtown, and Boston can do the same.

Private equity veteran is retiring

Kevin Landry reflects on a fast-paced career at Boston’s TA Associates that started as a summer job and spanned 45 years.
